description: Dive into "Sandakan Shopping Adventures Await" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Sandakan Shopping Adventures Await

places.generalDescription: Harbour Mall Sandakan may not be the most thrilling shopping destination, but it certainly covers the essentials for visitors. This contemporary mall is part of a revitalization project and boasts 20,000 square feet of retail space spread across five floors. Here, you can find a supermarket, pharmacy, and familiar Western brands like The Body Shop and McDonald's. The upper levels feature a market-style setup with various stalls selling trendy knock-off cosmetics and apparel.

sources.snippet: Harbour mall sandakan satu2nya shooping center pusat bandar sandakan dan di luar lapangan pula anda boleh lah mengambil gambar i love sandakan.
sources.shortName: Harbour Mall Sandakan, Sandakan, Sabah, Phone +60 89-276 888

places.name: Harbour Mall Sandakan Malaysia üá≤üáæüá≤üáæüá≤üáæ

reviews.text:
The only busy and happening shopping mall in Sandakan. It's lively, lots of shops and you can get most things here. Ground floor is the busiest.

There's a supermarket here with really good prices for general items. There's phone shops, clothes plus a McDs. 1st floor lots of Muslim ladies clothes. MBO cinema is on 11th floor.

Depends who you ask. We had a feeling that since at least a decade no one has been taking care of this place. Dirty walls, dirty toilets that charge 50 sen, old and shabby. Didn't expect that at all. Probably even in the early 2000's I didn't see this kind of mall anywhere in Europe, and paying for the toilet is ridiculous. Management of this place is definitely not doing a good job
Just an ordinary shopping place. The biggest in sandakan I guess. Crowded with people on sundays

places.address: Harbour Square, Pusat Bandar Sandakan, 90000 Sandakan, Sabah, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Sandakan Central Market is a bustling bazaar-like setting located near the waterfront, offering a wide array of local products and culinary delights. Visitors can explore three floors filled with gifts, crafts, souvenirs, sarongs, jewelry, fresh fruit, spices, and an extensive food market showcasing local specialties. The market also features discount shoes, bags, and cosmetics on the main floor and authentic food stands on the second floor.

sources.snippet: If you want to try some local food in Sandakan then check out the Sandakan Central Market which isn‚Äôt much to look at from the outside but is one of the tastiest spots in town. On the upper floors you will find a range of delicious eateries that serve up Chinese, Malay, and Filipino cuisine. One good tip is to make sure that you go in the early afternoon as most places close by around 3 pm.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things To Do In Sandakan (Malaysia)

places.name: Sandakan Central Market

reviews.text: Good place to buy fresh seafood to take back home. Ask the locals for pricing tips and haggle nicely with the traders ...

Nothing much to expect. Just a local market.

Selling meat, fruits, vegetables etc at the ground floor. Whereas food stalls are at the 1st floor.

Lift is available but looks dark and didn't show number of the floor on the top.
We had a morning walk and enjoyed  ÁÇ∏ËÇâÂ§ßÁ≤â at second floor

places.address: Jalan Pryer, Pusat Bandar Sandakan, 90000 Sandakan, Sabah, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: My Harbour Restaurant is a popular dining spot in Sandakan, offering a diverse range of culinary experiences. From fresh seafood to local delicacies and international cuisine, this restaurant has something for every palate. Located within the vibrant food scene of the city, it provides visitors with a chance to savor delicious meals while soaking in the lively atmosphere. Whether you're craving traditional Malaysian flavors or seeking familiar comfort foods, My Harbour Restaurant aims to cater to your dining preferences amidst a welcoming setting.

places.name: My Harbour Restaurant

reviews.text: A good restaurant serving local cuisine, located right on the promenade in the city centre. Outdoor terrace, relatively clean and beautiful view of the sea

Nice restaurant. The place is clean except for the toilet, really need to improve a lot on facilities sections. Cuisines were great. Seafood were fresh taken from the ocean, I guess. Crab wasn't too oily and greasy, just perfectly cooked. Beverages were normal, nothing interesting. Loved it though. The price was affordable. Service was great and the staff was friendly and helpful. Would love to recommend to other people out there and I'd definitely will come again soon :D

Food was ok, service was great as a very friendly woman helped us with our order. She took me to the kichen and showed us some fish from which I was able to choose which one we wanted. Had the fish in a hot and sour sauce which was great. Cheap beer here too, or at least seemingly cheaper than 7-11 at RM6.50 for a can of Tiger. I think the whole meal came to about ¬£13 (RM 65) with 4 beers.

We enjoyed watching the kittens and aren't bothered about any other 'wildlife' that may or may not be scurrying around, I actually didn't see anything else that other people have mentioned in previous reviews, it's Asia, get over it!

places.address: Lot 94-96 Block Hs-10 G/F Harbour Square, Jalan Pryer, 90000 Sandakan, Sabah, Malaysia
